This app allows police officers to collect evidence and also to ensure that the evidence is not destroyed or altered. At this point, the collection is the only thing going on - not the actual search.
Mobile Triage Guide
Sponsor by Detective
Home
Device Status
ON
OFF
Start
Always consult legal advisor or supervisor with forensic background before proceeding.
Please choose Your Device Status!
Please Choose Your Option!
<font color=#ff0000>WARNING!!!
Proceeding further is intended for forensic personnel or consult your supervisor for further directions.!!!
If situation is exigent (i.e. missing child, recent murder, etc.) consult your supervisor for which items may be needed first such as call history details, messages, etc..!!!
Does the device has any visible DNA that needs to be swabbed such as blood, fingerprints, etc?
Swab and collect DNA before proceeding with anything else.
Once completed, move on to step 2.
Does the device have user enabled security such as pin, a gesture, or a passcode?
Power off the device and collect it for further examination by trained investigator
Proceeding further is intended for forensic personnel or contact your supervisor for further directions, IF SITUATION IS EXIGENT THEN IMMEDIATELY CONTACT SUPERVISOR.
If possible, enable airplane mode internally before powering off.
Remove backing and pull the battery.
Hold screen lock button until power off option is displayed.
If device cannot be powered down, pull SIM.
Determine the make and model of the phone. Phone make and model can be found on a few areas:
On the device, look for the make (iPhone, Samsung, etc) which is usually in bigger font, and the word “model” to find the model.
If model is not visible from the outside, wait until a search warrant is obtained to pull the battery and search the inside.
If the situation is not exigent, obtain pictures of the device for reference.
Press home button located at the bottom of the screen once to open the lock screen
While screen is on, swipe finger from the bottom of the screen to the top to open the device’s Control Panel.
Then tap the airplane shaped icon to enable Airplane Mode.
Press home button located at the right of the screen until options are given.
Then select “Power off” or “Airplane mode” depending on what your supervisor instructs you to do.
Is the screen not accessible of is damaged?
Select Operating System
Different OS’s may require different steps to achieve the same results as Android so modify steps accordingly or contact your supervisor for further directions.
Note: If the screen is not accessible of is damaged, Please proceed to next step
If Android has 7.0+ security patch, follow directions below.
Put device into “Download Mode” by holding Power button and selecting “Restart” twice.

After selecting “restart” the second time, quickly hold down the Volume Down + Home Button + Power Button at the same time until the phone begins to reboot and hold until the screen shows the “Custom OS” screen.
Select “Continue” using the Volume Buttons
Once the next screen (Download Mode) appears, quickly press the Volume Down + Home + Power Buttons again until “Maintenance Boot Mode” screen appears.
Navigate using the Volume Buttons to previous step and then select using the Home Button
If this technique cannot be applied, get the device into any diagnostic mode (Download, Android Recovery, Maintenance, etc) and allow the phone to die just so that the network can be isolated.
This is an example
If internal settings are not accessible or cannot be used, wrap device in faraday mesh or bags to isolate network.
If faraday mesh/bags cannot be obtained, then wrap the device in a minimum of 3 layers of aluminum foil or place device in an empty paint can with the lid closed to complete faraday.
Make sure to test these methods out before implementing on live scenes to ensure its effectiveness.
Combining methods is also encouraged to increase effectiveness.

Investigator must obtain a search warrant to be able to search through a phone’s contents legally if situation is not exigent. Consult legal advisor about obtaining a legal warrant before proceeding to step 7.
With a live device, forensic personnel must attempt to obtain both a physical and logical extraction if supported by the device.
Anything that is extracted off the device
be validated through secondary means because evidence such as text messages can be “spoofed” and many examiners fail to perform this step. Suggestions for validation:
MUST
Use the GUI (Visual)
Obtain a Call Detail Records (CDR)
Cross Validate
Hand Carve
This report will be presented in court and will include many of the items listed above. With “live” devices, the report must clearly articulate what was done to preserve the evidence.

The legal portion of the report process is the number one target that defense will go after because they will want to suppress it before it can be presented before the jury. This is usually because defense doesn’t want incriminating texts, images, or videos that may implicate their clients.
Therefore, it is imperative to establish a sound reporting process that will accurately convey your findings.
Warning:
Does the device has any visible DNA that needs to be swabbed such as blood, fingerprints, etc?
Swab and collect DNA before proceeding with anything else.
Once completed, move on to step 2.
Determine the make and model of the phone. Phone make and model can be found on a few areas:
On the device, look for the make (iPhone, Samsung, etc) which is usually in bigger font, and the word “model” to find the model.
If model is not visible from the outside, wait until a search warrant is obtained to pull the battery and search the inside.
If the situation is not exigent, obtain pictures of the device for reference.

Investigator must obtain a search warrant to be able to search through a phone’s contents legally if situation is not exigent. Consult legal advisor about obtaining a legal warrant before proceeding to step 4.

Photograph all components to the device(s), including the SIM and Micro-SD card if applicable. These must be removed from device and processed independently so that they will not be influenced by the phone.
To prevent any changes from being made to the Micro-SD, enable the write blocker option when imaging the SD card on forensic tools.
If battery is removable, use a universal “probe” style charger and charge battery outside the phone.
If battery is not removable or does not charge with universal charger, take caution when charging through the charging port of the phone.
Charge through wall charger and NEVER charge through a USB computer port to prevent the phone from syncing to the computer and altering the contents.
Also provide a means of faraday in case the device powers on.

Devices such as Apple and Blackberry can turn on once they reach enough of a charge to trigger the boot process, which can cause them to touch the network and other wireless exchanges (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth).
If you have researched the device and determined it is a GSM with the SIM present and removable, a network isolation tool can be used to create a forensic SIM and isolate the network.
The forensic SIM obtains the ICCID and IMSI and is placed into the suspect’s phone.
This technique tricks the OS into seeing the original SIM, therefore keeping the stored data but also isolating the network.

Many pay-as-you-go- devices do not have an internal feature that isolates the network such as airplane mode. This technique can be used for GSM phones with SIMs that are powered off to examine the device properly.

Once battery is charged and processing of SIM and Micro-SD is finished, replace these items back into the device and begin extraction. Forensic personnel must attempt to obtain both a physical and logical extraction if supported by the device.
If device is GSM and does not have an internal faraday setting (airplane mode), consider forensic SIM or additional faraday steps.
If situation is exigent (i.e. missing child, recent murder, etc.) consult your supervisor for which items may be needed first such as call history details, messages, etc.

Anything that is extracted off the device MUST be validated through secondary means because evidence such as text messages can be “spoofed” and many examiners fail to perform this step. Suggestions for validation:
This report will be presented in court and will include many of the items listed above.

The legal portion of the report process is the number one target that defense will go after because they will want to suppress it before it can be presented before the jury. This is usually because defense doesn’t want incriminating texts, images, or videos that may implicate their clients. Therefore, it is imperative to establish a sound reporting process that will accurately convey your findings.

Congratulation! Triaging Process is done. Now you are ready to turn in what you have to the investigator. You can navigate to any steps on the left panel or go back to HOME to start a new phone.
THANK YOU
